comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
Name: Harold Abba 
Birth Place: Hull 
Death Date: 3 May 1917 
Death Location: France & Flanders 
Enlistment Location: Hull 
Rank: Private 
Regiment: East Yorkshire Regiment 
Battalion: 10th Battalion 
Number: 10/483 
Type of Casualty: Killed in action 
Theatre of War: Western European Theatre

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
According to census returns he was born in Hull in 1894 and was the son of Thomas Henry & Elizabeth Abba. In 1911, aged 16, he was a Junior Clerk in a Timber Merchant's Offices. His father was widowed and the family were living at 9 Spyvee Street, Sculcoates, Hull. His father was a House Furnisher and employed his two older brothers in the business.

His elder brother, Thomas Henry, had been killed in action four weeks earlier on 9 Apr 1917.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Private Harold H Abba (10th Battalion, East Yorkshire Regiment) and Lance Corporal Thomas Henry Abba (Yorkshire Regiment Green Howards) are both buried at Faubourg-d'Amiens Cemetery which is also known as the Arras Memorial. www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gsr&GSiman=1&a...
